feed.title: Vowpal Wabbit
feed.subtitle: Vowpal Wabbit provides a fast, flexible, online, and active learning solution that empowers you to solve complex interactive machine learning problems.

entry.title: Survey
entry.content:
As is the case with most open source projects, we have very little insight into how the project is used. VW does not collect any telemetry, so we rely on inferring usage patterns based on questions asked on Gitter, StackOverflow and issues raised on the Github repository. In order to better prioritize issues, new features and the direction of the project we decided to create a survey to give us some insight into how VW is used.

  • This survey is completely opt-in
  • Responses are anonymous
  • If you provide any personally identifiable information in any of the responses you give then we will delete the entire response

If you use VW and would like to help out the project then offering us some insight into how you use it is a fantastic way to help.

Thank you in advance!

Click here to fill out the survey.
entry.summary: Let us know how you use VW and what's important to you

entry.title: VowpalWabbit 8.11.0 Release Notes
entry.content:
• GitHub release
  • PyPi

Release highlights

pyVW related updates and improvments

  • VW for Python 3.9 added to Windows Python build (#2939)
  • VW for Python 2.7 and Python 3.5 will no longer be supported (#3118)

The Python DataFrame-to-VW effort has been growing, the latest available changes beeing:

  • A new tutorial showcasing the latest DataFrame to VW improvments here
  • Get weight from name (#3042)
  • Add weight attribute to SimpleLabel (#3033)
  • Add contextual bandit label to DFtoVW (#2713)

cb_to_cb_adf reduction

cb and cb_adf code paths have been consolidated into using the cb_adf path, without however issuing any breaking changes (#2680). cb examples are internally translated to cb_adf examples. This behaviour can be turned off by supplying the --cb_force_legacy flag when --cb N is used. The motivation behind this change is so that the cb reduction can benefit from the work done on cb_adf which has gotten more attention over the years

--cubic ::: and --interactions [:]* speedup

Using the wildcard (:) when doing cubic (--cubic :::) and higher order (--interactions ::::) interactions has been significantly sped up (#2993). This optimization now affects cubics and higher order interactions

Logging line limiting now available

A new flag has been added that allows the limiting of the log output of VW (#3021). By using --limit_output <N> a hard limit N can be set to the total printed lines. This does not include vw progressive validation loss output which will remain unaffected

Track upcoming deprecations

Upcoming deprecations can now be tracked here.

Deprecation warnings will be added in minor releases and the warnings will state the major release in which they will take effect.

Deprecation warnings for this release added to:

  • refactor: remove all usages of delete_v and deprecate (#3138)
  • refactor: deprecate some v_array functions (#3136)
  • refactor: remove all usages of v_init and deprecate (#3135)
  • refactor: deprecate ezexample (#3128)

Experimental: Metrics for debugging purposes

Experimental support for getting internal VW metrics has been added (#2959) and can be enabled using the --extra_metrics <output_file> argument. Currently richer information exists for reductions that use cb_explore (see example output for ccb_explore_adf here). The resulting json schema is still very fluid and is expected to change. Users that build and use VW from source can add their own metrics if they wish to do so. The metrics are also made available via the Python API (see here for a usage example) where they can be accessed via a Python dictionary

Multi-line example data files no longer need to have an extra newline for the last multi-line example at the end of the file

(#2890)

Some minor changes that are worth pointing out

  • fix!: cs_active now returns active_multiclass prediction (#2930)
  • fix!: Propagate cache reading failure (#2931)
  • feat: [dsjson] Malformed lines are now skipped instead of being fatal (#3007)
    • this can be turned off with the usage of --strict-parse

Internal improvements

Learners can now be built using templated builders (#2918) and reductions builders are slowly being transitioned to use the new builders.

Thank you

A huge thank you and welcome to all of the new contributors since the last release:

  • @seznam
  • @bassmang

And of course thank you to existing contributors:

  • @cirvine-MSFT
  • @ataymano
  • @cheng-tan
  • @etiennekintzler
  • @jackgerrits
  • @kumpera
  • @lalo
  • @olgavrou
  • @peterychang
  • @pmineiro
  • @rajan-chari
  • @Sharad24
  • @zwd-ms

Full changelist

Features

  • feat: add learner builder for no-data learners (#3100)
  • feat: [Tutorial] Using DFtoVW and exploring VW output (#3068)
  • feat: add chained_proxy_iterator to make it easier to iterate entire namespace index groups (#3076)
  • feat: [pyvw] Get weight from name (#3042)
  • feat: add cb benchmark with more features (#3080)
  • feat: add cache helper for reading and writing types directly (#3057)
  • feat: add several functions to namespaced_features (#3040)
  • feat: [metrics] cb_explore_adf additional metrics (#3032)
  • feat: [py] DFtoVW -> Add weight attribute to SimpleLabel (#3033)
  • feat: Create class to manage dual indexing of feature_groups (#3029)
  • feat: add flag to limit log output (#3021)
  • feat: [py] Add contextual bandit label to DFtoVW (#2713)
  • feat: add generic_range adapter class (#3025)
  • feat: [py] add api for learner metrics (#3022)
  • feat: [dsjson] Malformed lines are now skipped instead of being fatal (#3007)
  • feat: support cached interaction expansion as a reduction (#2993)
  • feat: [metrics] add optional metrics for –dsjson (#2992)
  • feat: [metrics] add support for float (#2991)
  • feat: add optional extra metrics (#2959)
  • feat: [cb_adf_explore] prog val print known label (#2961)
  • feat: consolidate math functions and add combinatorial related funcs (#2965)
  • feat: [cb cb_adf] prog val print known label (#2957)
  • feat: Add cb_to_cb_adf reduction (#2680)
  • feat: Add active multiclass to C# API (#2958)
  • feat: cross-release benchmarks (#2948)
  • feat: Enable reduction_features to be accessed from label_parser functions (#2916)

Fixes

  • fix: Use random state in sample_pdf, Resolves #3116 (#3150)
  • fix: Multiline Example handling when in multi-pass mode (#3143)
  • fix: Fix CB label caching (#3141)
  • fix: [Python] Fix default parameter convert_labels in sklearn_vw.VWRegressor (#3129)
  • fix: cats getting stuck to predicting tree edges for some bandwidths (#3114)
  • fix: use nullptr ostream when quiet is on (#3119)
  • fix: fix two compiler warnings (#3123)
  • fix: Check label type for shared features, Resolves #3088 (#3120)
  • fix: [cb_to_cb_adf] multiple costs in label (#3126)
  • fix: setup_example should not be called twice on the same example (#3115)
  • fix: [DFtoVW] Fix issue with nan/None in feature (#3109)
  • fix: fix gdb pretty printer (#3079)
  • fix: do not change spdlog global settings (#3077)
  • fix: cmake build (#3071)
  • fix: Baseline should signal its enablement through an index and not a feature (#3069)
  • fix: Fix model corruption on reading model (#3063)
  • fix: avoid printing extra things when using –help (#3060)
  • fix: Fix of learning on data with pdrop (#3055)
  • fix: natvis definition had incorrect member variable name (#3044)
  • fix: [metrics] set to zero (#3035)
  • fix: set default learn_returns_prediction to false, refactor cover (#3017)
  • fix: refactor cb_explore_adf_first (#3012)
  • fix: Refactor regcb with make_reduction_learner (#3010)
  • fix: Refactor squarecb with make_reduction_learner (#3009)
  • fix: warning for const qualifier on reference type (#3008)
  • fix: regcb save_load and keep mellowness (#3006)
  • fix: remove non printable ascii char from tests (#3005)
  • fix: [metrics] account for label action not predicted (#3004)
  • fix: cb_explore_adf_first.cc save_load (#2997)
  • fix: keep gamm_exponent in squarecb (#2999)
  • fix: [metrics] add missing ccb tests (#2996)
  • fix: bfgs preconditioner, Resolves #2745 (#2995)
  • fix: Added save_load to squarcb (#2988)
  • fix: Add read_line_json_s function taking line length (#2968)
  • fix: Unify duplicated error code headers (#2978)
  • fix: use nullptr instead of NULL (#2980)
  • fix: Avoid float to double promotion by using C++ version of math functions (#2979)
  • fix: fixes for headers not including things they need (#2974)
  • fix: attempt to fix windows failures (#2956)
  • fix!: cs_active now returns active_multiclass prediction (#2930)
  • fix: fix cost assignment in cats tree (#2900)
  • fix: cb_adf learn_returns_prediction (#2953)
  • fix!: Propagate cache reading failure (#2931)
  • fix: Stash benchmark scripts (#2950)
  • fix: set json reader correctly when source is reset (#2947)
  • fix: assert in custom_streambuf.h (#2946)
  • fix: invert hash with –save_resume does not include feature name (#2940)
  • fix: [Version update to 8.10.1] make example_is_newline check depend on bool instead of internal example characteristics (#2890)

Other changes

  • style: Use float instead of float ref (#2986)
  • style: Give template types more descriptive names (#2984)
  • refactor: rename file namespaced_features -> namespaced_feature_store (#3154)
  • refactor: return ScoredDual with bound (#3121)
  • refactor: remove all usages of delete_v and deprecate (#3138)
  • refactor: Don’t use a shared ptr for audit (#3134)
  • refactor: deprecate some v_array functions (#3136)
  • refactor: use destructor to manage memory (#3131)
  • refactor: remove all usages of v_init and deprecate (#3135)
  • refactor: simplify search memory management (#3132)
  • refactor: do not need to call delete_v anymore (#3130)
  • refactor: deprecate ezexample (#3128)
  • refactor: remove cast in slim tests (#3098)
  • refactor: Fix unnecessary usages of char* (#3085)
  • refactor: add label and use builder to set learner features in cb_dro.cc (#3059)
  • refactor: Organize cache usage behind two functions for testing (#3058)
  • refactor: Refactor cats_tree.cc to use builder to set features of learner (#3053)
  • refactor: remove unnecessary delete_v_array call (#3050)
  • refactor: Refactor cb_sample.cc to use builder to set features of learner (#3039)
  • refactor: Use default copy constructor for features (#3038)
  • refactor: avoid v_array copy in cats_tree (#3037)
  • refactor: cb_adf learner (#3036)
  • refactor: Avoid v_array copies (#3030)
  • refactor: cb_explore_pdf (#3026)
  • refactor: cb_explore_adf_synthcover (#3024)
  • refactor: cb_explore_adf_greedy (#3023)
  • refactor: Non printable namespaces should not be wildcard expanded (#3020)
  • refactor: CCB participates in interaction reduction expansion (#3013)
  • refactor: cb_explore_adf_bag.cc make_reduction_learner (#3016)
  • refactor: refactor cb_explore_adf_rnd.cc with make_reduction_learner (#3014)
  • refactor: cb_explore_adf_softmax.cc with make_reduction_learner (#3015)
  • refactor: eval_count_of_generated_ft PR follow up (#3011)
  • refactor: [metrics] cb_explore_adf optional metrics (#2998)
  • refactor: Integrate count and sum feat sq into the interaction generation routine (#2987)
  • refactor: Support const iterators to feature groups (#2972)
  • refactor: Do not use cstyle casts (guideline 16) (#2981)
  • refactor: Remove unused foreach_feature func (#2973)
  • refactor: migrate active_cover learner init (#2960)
  • refactor: move shared_data to its own header (#2928)
  • refactor: update slates setup to new way (#2935)
  • refactor: Migrate ccb to new make learner structure (#2923)
  • refactor: migrate bfgs to new style learner creation (#2926)
  • refactor: Remove delete_label (#2925)
  • refactor: remove delete_unions (#2924)
  • refactor: Simple label uses reduction features for initial (#2920)
  • refactor: Remove copy label (#2921)
  • refactor: Refactor learner construction (#2918)
  • refactor: [DFtoVW] Use more generic numpy types, add attribute name to Feature (#2909)
  • refactor: Reduce number of raw pointers (#2915)
  • test: [chisq] add validation test with py impl test (#3147)
  • test: get type information of VW options (#3142)
  • test: update runtests.AUTOGEN.json (#3140)
  • test: add to cmakelists unit test for cb_dro (#3117)
  • test: [py] fix seed for sim test (#3101)
  • test: add tests for namespaces with same first letter (#3096)
  • test: [py] fix random failure by lowering value (#3089)
  • test: Add test for self interaction with multiple feature_groups (#3074)
  • test: add cb simulation tutorial as test (#3072)
  • test: add baseline test (#3070)
  • test: ensure python3 is used for test scripts (#3041)
  • test: Add tests for vw_math and fix one function (#2966)
  • build: MSVC check must be done before project call (#3113)
  • build: Enable building Python library using VS2019 (#3078)
  • build: [WIP] Enable building C# projects on Windows with CMake (#2929)
  • build: add 3.9 to windows python build (#2939)
  • build: Update build_python_wheels_macos.yml (#2937)
  • ci: lock to specific version of google test in benchmark CI (#3137)
  • ci: Build docs as part of CI (#3090)
  • ci: Add Python type checking (#3105)
  • ci: Reduce CI burden (#3048)
  • ci: Add codecov token to help codecov identify uploaded coverage reports (#3045)
  • ci: Make LGTM ignore ext_libs directory (#2967)
  • ci: Use the base ref of a PR to compare against for benchmarks (#2955)
  • ci: fix invalid job name (#2954)
  • ci: standardize ci names (#2952)
  • ci: run CI on release branches (#2942)
  • ci: update brew to mitigate bintray brownout (#2941)
  • ci: Update check_pr_title.yml (#2922)
  • ci: Enable CI for VW Slim (#2914)
  • chore: remove unused file (#3152)
  • chore: Update deprecations to be explicit about 9.0 release (#3103)
  • chore: add deprecation notice for #3084 feature_self_interactions (#3099)
  • chore: fix deprecation issue template (#3092)
  • chore: add requirements file to be used by binder (#3087)
  • chore: Add deprecation template (#3028)
  • chore: Make it clear that gitter and stack overflow are "conversational" issue options (#3047)
  • chore: Delete new_version (#2932)
  • revert: Revert path include changes (#3049)
  • Update dev environment to use new image (#3001)
  • Fixing json parse issue when pdrop is 0 (#2977)
  • fix newline when building standalone benchmarks (#2951)
  • fix typo (#2949)
  • Fix python manifest for ext_libs (#2938)
  • Update .clang-format (#2917)
  • Create check_pr_title.yml (#2919)
  • Remove caching of Windows CI build targets (#2913)
entry.summary: Documentation improvments, Python API improvements, cb_to_cb_adf reduction, deprecations and more in VW 8.11.0!

entry.title: Open Meeting
entry.content:
• Join link
  • Agenda
  • Every second Thursday, 11:30 AM New York local time

Open Meeting

We hold a meeting every two weeks where we discuss open pull requests, pending work, open issues and ideas for the future. We wanted to extend an invite to for anyone who would like to join. This is an opportunity to come and speak to the Vowpal Wabbit developers, ask any questions, suggest a feature or just listen in and see whats happening.

If you wish to bring up a topic please comment on the issue dedicated to that particular date in the agenda repo. The issue title also has the date and time of that occurance in case you forget.

The meeting is held with Microsoft teams. Click here to join the meeting. This blog post will be kept up to date with the most current information, should the link ever change for example.
entry.summary: Come and chat at the open meeting

entry.title: VowpalWabbit 8.10.0 Release Notes
entry.content:
• GitHub release
  • PyPi

-q :: speedup

Using the wildcard (:) when doing quadratic interactions (-q ::) has been significantly sped up (#2807). This optimization only affects quadratics interactions for now, and not cubics or higher order interactions.

We saw a 35% speedup for one of the benchmarks which tests quadratic interactions. Additionally, we saw that the runtime for a CCB ADF run with a file of 347k examples and 3 interactions (Action, Slot, User) from ~11m41s to ~1m50s.

Initial ARM Support

We’ve added initial ARM support with this release. VW should now be able to build on ARM platforms, we are not yet supporting binary Python wheels on ARM yet though. The command line tool is now supported natively on Apple Silicon, and will be available once the Homebrew package is updated to 8.10.0.

Logging changes

We’ve made some steps to improve logging in VW, starting with unifying what we have on one system and adding log levels. This is still a bit of a work in progress, and so not all output quite follows it yet.

  • Progressive validation remains the same
  • Other logging messages have a log level prepended to the line

Goals of the logging work

  • Easier to understand warnings, info, errors, etc
  • Ability to filter by level
  • Machine readable log format
  • More sensible output when VW is used as a library

Comparison

Old
Num weight bits = 18
learning rate = 0.5
initial_t = 0
power_t = 0.5
using no cache
Reading datafile = train-sets/malformed.dat
num sources = 1
Enabled reductions: gd, scorer
average  since         example        example  current  current  current
loss     last          counter         weight    label  predict features
malformed example! '|',space, or EOL expected after : "| x:0.7"in Example #0: "| x:0.7"
malformed example! '|' or EOL expected after : "| x:0.7"in Example #0: "| x:0.7"
New
Num weight bits = 18
learning rate = 0.5
initial_t = 0
power_t = 0.5
using no cache
Reading datafile = train-sets/malformed.dat
num sources = 1
Enabled reductions: gd, scorer
average  since         example        example  current  current  current
loss     last          counter         weight    label  predict features
[warning] malformed example! '|',space, or EOL expected after : "| x:0.7"in Example #0: "| x:0.7"
[warning] malformed example! '|' or EOL expected after : "| x:0.7"in Example #0: "| x:0.7"

Experimental: Flatbuffers

Experimental support for Flatbuffer schematized examples as an input format has been added. Flatbuffers are a schematized binary format and should provide efficiency and portability when used. This is still experimental as we want to ensure the schema is complete for real world use, and because documentation is currently limited, not all binaries released support it and tooling to make it easier to work with is not there yet. The schema for the example objects can be found here, but the file itself contains a sequence of size prefixed such objects to allow streamed input.

When building from source support is disabled by default but can be enabled by passing -BUILD_FLATBUFFERS=ON to the CMake configure step.

Contextual Bandit Zeroth Order Optimization

Contextual Bandit Zeroth Order Optimization (CBZO) is a new reduction (contributed by @ajay0). CBZO is a contextual bandit-style algorithm meant for a multi-dimensional, continuous action space. It can learn different policies based on Zeroth-Order Optimization – continuous optimization techniques which make use of gradient estimators that only require values of the function to make an estimate. The variant of CBZO currently implemented in VW works in the 1-dimensional action space setting and can learn either constant or linear policies. The algorithm has optimal bounded regret when the cost function is smooth and convex.

Learn more at the wiki page.

Internal improvements

  • Progress towards label information not being required in predict calls and reducing the number of redundant predict calls done before a learn call takes place
  • New Python test runner script which supports parallelized tests
  • Overhaul v_array to be an RAII type
  • Enable prediction and label structures to be RAII types

Thank you

A huge thank you and welcome to all of the new contributors since the last release:

  • @ajay0
  • @orktes
  • @zhxiaogg

And of course thank you to existing contributors:

  • @ataymano
  • @cheng-tan
  • @etiennekintzler
  • @jackgerrits
  • @kumpera
  • @lalo
  • @olgavrou
  • @peterychang
  • @pmineiro
  • @rajan-chari
  • @Sharad24
  • @zwd-ms

Full changelist

  • Revert “Migrate example copying to clone function and deprecate old methods” (#2911)
  • Add missing {} in fmt strings (#2910)
  • Migrate example copying to clone function and deprecate old methods (#2906)
  • Fix learn semantics (#2207)
  • coin weights fix (#2844)
  • Fix memory tree demo (#2908)
  • Deprecate v_array::resize (#2905)
  • Deprecate v_array incr and decr (#2904)
  • Deprecate explicit copy functions and use std::copy as implementation (#2903)
  • cb model 2 ccb trainer (#2884)
  • [test] draw reduction graph (#2896)
  • Create a CMake based Windows CI (#2894)
  • v_array: rename end_array -> _end_array (#2901)
  • v_array: rename actual_resize -> resize_but_with_stl_behavior (#2902)
  • Only add sse flags on x86 systems (#2899)
  • label initialization (#2879)
  • add ability to use system installs for fmt, spdlog (#2898)
  • Make v_array internals private, don’t allow begin/end to be modified (#2874)
  • Use trace_message for shared_data output (#2883)
  • Replace strncpy wit memcpy as the former is flagged as unsafe by linters. (#2869)
  • [ci] cache nuget (#2887)
  • Create benchmark workflow that can be manually run for two refs (#2889)
  • Fix incorrect {VW} substitution (#2892)
  • move fmt-dependent definitions into its own header to avoid exposing … (#2895)
  • Support Loading the VW JNI library from JAR. (#2886)
  • Support valgrind in the Python runtests (#2893)
  • Use newer resize in plt (#2878)
  • [Flatbuffers] actually skip tests that flatbuffers don’t convert in flatbuffers run_test (#2882)
  • ftrl learners invert_hash fix (#2853)
  • [Flatbuffers] add initial field to simple label (and enable –nn test) (#2885)
  • [py] add enabled_reductions api (#2877)
  • Update format_check.yml (#2881)
  • Use erase for ignore some (#2875)
  • Fix calloc_reserve and push_many (#2873)
  • Logger libs (#2876)
  • v_array insert range (#2872)
  • Move rapidjson to ext_libs folder. Fix fmt/spdlog install (#2870)
  • [test] RunTests VW options coverage script (#2868)
  • Report completion for skipped tests (#2857)
  • Add json parsing for dedup-ed examples (#2848)
  • Remove unneeded deletes from tests (#2845)
  • Do a fuzzy float compare instead of exact (#2855)
  • Use insert and erase in interact (#2846)
  • Add test for interact reduction (#2850)
  • Refactoring VW logging (#2813)
  • [test] add missing diff files (#2865)
  • fix (#2864)
  • add vw empty version (#2863)
  • [cb, cb_explore] small refactor for reuse (#2862)
  • [cbify] cbify_adf_data refactor (#2861)
  • [test] check for missing test ids (#2860)
  • re-enable fb tests (#2858)
  • fb off by default in linux build (#2856)
  • Use insert for search push_at (#2847)
  • Let external parser link libraries to vw (#2854)
  • Add bounds check for explicit test number running (#2849)
  • Inject artificial dependencies for bash script based tests (#2851)
  • Implement v_array::insert for single elements (#2843)
  • Remove the inner v_array from io_buf (#2837)
  • Don’t use implementation details of v_array in helper functions (#2842)
  • Explicit delete_v is no longer needed (#2841)
  • Remove search v_array misuse (#2840)
  • Implement v_array::erase (#2838)
  • add scaffolding for adding an external (binary) parser (#2829)
  • [CATS ] report average loss instead of label cost (#2791)
  • fix –help’s help message (#2836)
  • Fix a case where VW would wait for more input on stdin rather than returning the already complete line (#2835)
  • Enforce that v_array only contains TriviallyCopyable types (#2831)
  • v_array unit tests (#2830)
  • Ataymano/python safe constructor (#2826)
  • Fix confusing API - dealloc_example (#2828)
  • add quiet check before outputting to trace_message (#2833)
  • v_array cleanup (#2824)
  • Add reserve, resize_actual, make erase_count private (#2823)
  • Remove manual prediction deletion now that it is automatic (#2827)
  • Fix make_config PreBuildEvent for windows build (#2825)
  • Remove code that can now be default (#2821)
  • Add capacity function to v_array and migrate usage (#2822)
  • Deprecate v_array pop and last in favor of standardized pop_back and back (#2819)
  • Fix string too long compile error (#2817)
  • [v_array] Make v_array an RAII type (#2771)
  • [Prediction] Modernize polypred a little by introducing ctor. (#2775)
  • Make -q :: faster by calculating interactions on the fly instead of pre calculating them (#2807)
  • Add predictions to test comparisons (#2816)
  • [CATS] bandwidth as a property of continuous action range (#2788)
  • Fix fallback fuzzy compare (#2815)
  • Fix parse_neighbor_features function (#2811)
  • Add name field to learner and add learner callstack print statements (#2624)
  • Consolidate ostream inner sink to using VW::io::writer framework (#2801)
  • Consolidate get_observed_cost implementations (#2792)
  • Add more tests for interactions (#2806)
  • [nn] fix double free (#2802)
  • Refactor trace_message and vw_ostream to allow for arbitrary streambuf objects (#2800)
  • don’t fail in vcpkg auto link check if vcpkg is not configured (#2797)
  • Make flatbuffers optional (#2696)
  • check for newline when ccb in parser (#2796)
  • enable audit info in flatbuffers (#2794)
  • [py] fix test (#2756)
  • Don’t export lib symbols from vw_jni binary when static linking (#2789)
  • Make label_type a property of label_parser (#2784)
  • [help] fix inconsistencies (#2783)
  • Full RunTests for flatbuffers (#2741)
  • Filtered –help output by enabled reductions (#2718)
  • share example (namespace) objects inside object collections (#2729)
  • [py] add native python vw config (#2629)
  • [py] fix log issue (#2778)
  • refactor header print to sd (#2776)
  • [py] convenience api to get cerr/cout vw output (#2749)
  • [test] add vw version test (#2774)
  • [test] fix exception message of test (#2770)
  • Make prediction a struct. (#2761)
  • Fix cbzo test dependency mention (#2769)
  • Change Polylabel to a struct of objects instead of union (#2275)
  • fix invert hash (#2768)
  • printable slot interactions (#2767)
  • Fail instead of returning default (#2765)
  • Typed option update (#2753)
  • Fix some warnings (#2762)
  • Add flatbuffer label for continuous actions (#2743)
  • Add Python 3.9 wheel for Linux (#2752)
  • Decouple concrete option type from the building interface (#2759)
  • [cbify] Fix another dangling pointer in example to a cached v_array. (#2758)
  • ccb test can have outcomes and explicit included actions (#2742)

  • Duplicated interactions issue mitigation (#2746)
  • Revert "redirect cerr and cout (#2710)" (#2757)
  • Fix fallthrough warning (#2754)

  • Add python bindings for pdf prediction type (#2744)
  • Fix missing progressive validation header (#2750)
  • Update types used as option input (#2734)
  • redirect cerr and cout (#2710)
  • Add required new option type for constrained option input types (#2738)
  • Adding a new line at the end of 2 multiline tests (#2740)
  • Fix some flatbuffer bugs (#2739)
  • Cats pdf hint in text (#2728)
  • [cbify] Fix dangling pointer in example due prediction array caching. (#2730)
  • Runtests driver in Python (#2715)
  • Pass reduction features to label parsers (#2727)
  • Remove unused label_size from label_parser struct (#2716)
  • Benchmark fixes (#2726)
  • Increase benchmarks to 10 reps, 2s min time (#2725)
  • Rcv1 benchmarks (#2722)
  • Vcpkg do not link everything (#2720)
  • Update run-benchmarks.sh (#2723)
  • Fix MacCI: uninstall openssl not needed anymore
  • Flatbuffers multi_ex (#2717)
  • [test] runtest parser feature mask fix (#2714)
  • [test] add –help test (#2712)
  • Use ProjectDir for fb schema location (#2711)
  • make options a unique_ptr (#2705)
  • Fix issue with index in DFtoVW.empty_col (#2703)
  • Turn CCB sanity checks into reported errors (#2698)
  • Make a copy when doing text based parsing (#2706)
  • [py] Run parser automatically based on str (#2702)
  • Run doctest in Python CI (#2708)
  • Fix examples in python lib docs (#2707)
  • renaming (#2704)
  • Add test to check regression of dsjson in python (#2699)
  • Update vw.h (#2700)
  • CCB don’t ignore slot namespace in interactions when slots have default namespace (#2684)
  • Use variable for port (#2701)
  • Fix missing test ref files (#2697)
  • Use unique ports in each test (#2695)
  • CB-as-CCB action indexing fix (#2689)
  • Allow port to be selected in spanning tree tool (#2692)
  • Do not go up directory in test definitions (#2690)
  • [test] Add dicionary and feature_mask (#2693)
  • To ensure runs are identical cache tests should use kill cache (#2688)
  • Add two safe numeric casts (#2679)
  • Update restore.sh (#2683)
  • Cats response during inference based on user provided hints (#2643)
  • Add third party notice (#2664)
  • fix types (#2677)
  • Stream flatbuffers instead of reading entire file (#2670)
  • [test] runtests parser (#2651)
  • Access union types with field access instead of cstyle casts (#2665)
  • Fix CMake for libvw and libvw_c_wrapper install (#2673)
  • Remove a raw pointer (#2666)
  • cats via python (#2668)
  • Syntheticcover exploration (#2663)
  • Fix options warnings on macos (#2660)
  • Remove generated flatbuffer file (#2661)
  • Fix cover bug (#2647)
  • Flatbuffers (#2496)
  • Refactor explore_eval fix (#2642)
  • add learn benchmarks (#2657)
  • added java api binding for ccb learner (#2644)
  • fix FOLDER_NAME variable in build_docs.yml (#2655)
  • remove deprecated set-env (#2654)
  • [tests] fix format of comments (#2649)
  • Update build_python_wheels_macos.yml (#2650)
  • update builds to point to latest vw image (#2641)
  • Add framework for managing predict_data in the reduction stack (#2282)
  • Update PACKAGE.rst (#2640)
entry.summary: Quadratic interaction speed improvements, ARM support, logging updates and more in VW 8.10.0!

entry.title: RL Open Source Fest is back for 2021

link.title: RL Open Source Fest is back for 2021

entry.content:
Apply here!

A successful first RLOS Fest

In the (northern hemisphere) summer of 2020, we had the absolute pleasure of collaborating with 6 students from 3 continents on solving real problems in the Vowpal Wabbit ecosystem. The Reinforcement Learning Open Source (RLOS) Fest was organized and run by Microsoft Research. RLOS was a remote program, so we were fortunate that as the world was adjusting to new circumstances, we were able to continue as planned.

There were over 200 applications for the program, and it was an incredibly difficult task to narrow down the many impressive applicants. In the end, we landed on a group of 6 and the amazing work done over this summer was a testament to the incredible talent that was attracted to the program. Thank you to all applicants for your interest! See below to learn more about them and see demos of the great work they did.

Onwards to 2021

We’re extra excited that the program is returning for 2021! To learn more about the program head to the MSR page. The list of available projects for this year can be found here.

Our collaborators for 2020

  • Sharad Chitlangia
    • Pushing the limits of VW with Flatbuffers
    • Demo
  • Cassandra Marcussen
    • Parallelized parsing
    • Demo
  • Harish Kamath
    • Conversion of VowpalWabbit models into ONNX format
    • Demo
  • Newton Mwai Kinyanjui
    • Library of contextual bandit estimators
    • Demo
  • Mark Rucker
    • COBA: A modern benchmarking package for reproducible contextual bandit research
    • Demo
  • Milind Agarwal
    • Contextual bandit data visualization with Jupyter notebooks
    • Demo
entry.summary: The first RLOS Fest in 2020 was great, now we're back this year for another!

entry.title: VowpalWabbit @ NeurIPS 2020
entry.content:
For a long time John Langford and others have presented about VW at the yearly NeurIPS and ICML conferences. This year was no different, apart from the fact that for the first time NeurIPS was completely online and remote. A benefit of this is that the complete workshop is now accessible online to anyone.

A huge thanks to everyone who presented, especially to Jacob Alber who organized the entire workshop.

The entire presentation is available here.

Sections:

  • Introduction
    • Presenter: John Langford
    • Start time: 00:00:19
    • Slides
  • Probabilistic Label Trees
    • Presenter: Marek Wydmuch
    • Start time: 00:11:23
    • Slides
  • Contextual Bandits with Continuous Actions
    • Presenter: Maryam Majzoubi
    • Start time: 00:30:41
    • Slides
  • Slates
    • Presenters: Adith Swaminathan & Jack Gerrits
    • Start time: 00:52:39
    • Slides part 1
    • Slides part 2
  • SquareCB
    • Presenter: Dylan Foster
    • Start time: 01:10:55
  • Distributionally-Robust CB
    • Presenter: Paul Mineiro
    • Start time: 01:30:26
  • CB Visualizations
    • Presenter: Milind Agarwal
    • Start time: 01:50:41
    • Slides
  • CB Benchmarks
    • Presenter: Mark Rucker
    • Start time: 02:07:42
    • Slides

You can find some of the content from past years here:

  • NeurIPS 2019
  • ICML 2019

entry.title: VowpalWabbit 8.9.0 Release Notes
entry.content:
• GitHub release
  • PyPi

It’s been a while since we last released, but a lot of exciting things have been going on!

Let’s take a look at some of the big items from this release.

Python Wheels

We now produce Python wheels for most platforms which are uploaded to PyPi. This means you almost never have to build from source to use VW in Python! We’re committed to making using VW in Python a great experience, and this is just the first step.

String feature values in text format

In a small expansion of the text format you can now supply a string as the value for a feature. This strictly adds a case which is now valid and doesn’t affect any existing valid data files. If this was tried previously you’d receive a malformed example warning and the feature would be skipped. When a feature value is supplied in this way the hash is now calculated as hash(feature_value, hash(feature_name, namespace_hash)) where hash’s signature is hash(input, seed). This chained hashing is denoted by a ^ in the audit output.

echo "| myname:myvalue" | vw --audit

Output:

Num weight bits = 18 learning rate = 0.5 initial_t = 0 power_t = 0.5 using no cache Reading datafile = num sources = 1 Enabled reductions: gd, scorer average since example example current current current loss last counter weight label predict features 0 myname^myvalue:112555:1:0@0 Constant:116060:1:0@0 n.a. n.a. 1 1.0 unknown 0.0000 2

finished run number of examples = 1 weighted example sum = 1.000000 weighted label sum = 0.000000 average loss = n.a. total feature number = 2

  • Input format wiki
  • Audit wiki

Continuous Actions

CATS is a contextual bandit algorithm with a continuous action space. It uses epsilon greedy exploration with tree policy classes and smoothing.

CATS, utilizing the features given as input, will first choose a center from a continuous action range using a tree policy, and then will use a bandwidth to determine a radius of randomization around the chosen center (centers or discrete actions). The depth of the tree and the bandwidth need to be specified beforehand.

Thanks to Maryam Majzoubi (@mmajzoubi) for this contribution.

  • Read the paper
  • Learn more at the wiki page
  • Pull request

Square CB

Square CB is a new exploration algorithm for contextual bandits which works by reducing contextual bandits to regression. It is the first reduction of this type that provably has optimal performance for contextual bandits, and has comparable runtime to other basic exploration algorithms such as epsilon-greedy. Empirically, it has been shown that it has competitive performance on the large-scale evaluation setup from the bake-off paper.

Thanks to Dylan Foster (@canondetortugas) for this contribution.

  • Learn more at the wiki page
  • Pull request

Probabilistic Label Tree

Probabilistic label tree is a new reduction for logarithmic time multilabel classification. It is especially useful when there is a large number of classes, around 10000 or more.

Thanks to Marek Wydmuch (@mwydmuch) for this contribution.

  • Read the paper
  • See a demo of it
  • Pull request

Slates

Slates is a multi slot algorithm which builds upon the ideas of Conditional Contextual Bandit. It adds the following constraints:

  1. There is a single global reward
  2. Slots have disjoint action sets
  • Learn more at the wiki page
  • Pull request

Contextual Bandit Distributionally Robust Optimization

This reduction adds support for distributionally robust optimization for contextual bandits in VW.

  • Learn more at the wiki page
  • Pull request

CB Explore ADF RND

This adds a new exploration algorithm for CB ADF inspired by random network distillation.

  • Learn more at the wiki page (point 5.)
  • Pull request

Initial Pandas support in Python

We introduced in this release DFtoVW, a class that converts pandas.DataFrame object into VW input format. To use import it from vowpalwabbit.DFtoVW. We currently support simple label, multiclass label and feature transformations.

Example:

from vowpalwabbit.DFtoVW import DFtoVW, SimpleLabel, Feature, Namespace
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame({"y": [1, -1], "a": [2, 3], "b": [3, 2]})
conv1 = DFtoVW(df=df,
    label=SimpleLabel("y"),
    features=[Feature("a"), Feature("b")])
conv1.convert_df()
# ['1 | a:2 b:3', '-1 | a:3 b:2']

conv2 = DFtoVW(df=df,
    label=SimpleLabel("y"),
    namespaces=[Namespace(name="ns1", features=Feature("a"))])
conv2.convert_df()
# ['1 |ns1 a:2', '-1 |ns1 a:3']
  • Input format wiki
  • Documentation
  • More examples
  • Code

Thanks to Etienne Kintzler (@etiennekintzler) for this contribution.

New options

--chain_hash

In the JSON and DSJSON formats when a string was supplied as a value the old behavior was to concatenate the property name with the value. This option changes the behavior to hash the feature name a long with the value to determine the feature index. The old behavior is deprecated and you’ll receive a warning if --chain_hash is not supplied and you are using either --json or --dsjson. The old behavior will be removed in a future version.

  • Pull request

--local

When a model is saved in active learning mode, it resumes active learning when loaded (i.e., it starts listening for input on a port and ignoring local sources). This option allows the user to change this behaviour (so that the Python library can interact with the loaded model, for example).

Contributed by @zechyw.

  • Pull request

--dry_run

This option will skip running the driver. It is especially helpful with the new diagnostic about enabled reductions.

Example:

vw --ccb_explore_adf --dry_run

Output:

Num weight bits = 18 learning rate = 0.5 initial_t = 0 power_t = 0.5 using no cache Reading datafile = num sources = 1 Enabled reductions: gd, scorer, csoaa_ldf, cb_adf, cb_explore_adf_greedy, cb_sample, shared_feature_merger, ccb_explore_adf

finished run number of examples = 0 weighted example sum = 0.000000 weighted label sum = 0.000000 average loss = n.a. total feature number = 0

  • Pull request

--nounif

This option was added to cb_explore with cover so that it can behave the same way as cb_explore_adf_cover which provides a switch for turning off the uniform exploration on zero-probability actions. Uniform exploration on zero-probability actions is now on by default in cb cover to match the existing behavior of cb_explore_adf_cover.

  • Pull request

Other improvements

  • Automatic documentation generation on each commit. Published here: https://vowpalwabbit.org/docs
  • Valgrind checking on every pull request
  • Formatting checks on PR diffs
  • Invert hash now includes all weights even if they do not have an audit string
  • Use TCP_NODELAY for daemon sockets to avoid Nagle introducing long delay
  • Use a power of 10 lookup table to improve VW text parser perf for exp lookups
  • Refactor IO abstractions into generic writers and readers

Thank you

A huge thank you and welcome to all of the new contributors since the last release:

  • @adityauser
  • @canondetortugas
  • @etiennekintzler
  • @mmajzoubi
  • @mritunjaysharma394
  • @mwydmuch
  • @olgavrou
  • @RituRajSingh878
  • @SchuylerGoodman
  • @Sharad24
  • @Smit-create
  • @thealphadollar
  • @timgates42
  • @zechyw
  • @zwd-ms

And of course thank you to existing contributors:

  • @arielf
  • @ataymano
  • @cheng-tan
  • @gramhagen
  • @jackgerrits
  • @kumpera
  • @lalo
  • @lokitoth
  • @peterychang
  • @pmineiro
  • @rajan-chari

Full changelist

  • Build and upload documentation for each release (#2381) - Jack Gerrits
  • Implement the core reduction for slates (#2347) - Jack Gerrits
  • Added doc template and feature request template (#2361) - Ritu Raj Singh
  • Fix return reference to temporary local bug (#2373) - Jack Gerrits
  • Documentation correction of pyvw.py (#2336) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Added tests to increase coverage (#2276) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Remove Boost::thread dependency (#2379) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix warning where only copy assignment constructor was defined, can be replaced with defaults (#2372) - Jack Gerrits
  • Update build_docs.yml (#2376) - Jack Gerrits
  • Add basic contents to the doxygen mainpage (#2377) - Jack Gerrits
  • Reorder path in RunTests so that local build takes priority over installed VW (#2380) - Jack Gerrits
  • Prevent overwriting passes when data is passed in VW at object creation (#2364) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Only override RelWithDebInfo flags for non MSVC situations (#2375) - Jack Gerrits
  • LDA / minibatch bug fix (#2334) - Eduardo Salinas
  • Added –quiet arg (#2360) - Aditya Singh
  • Ignore tmp.model (#2367) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Only run upload on master repository (#2365) - Jack Gerrits
  • Enable automatic building and hosting of documentation for every new commit (#2350) - Jack Gerrits
  • [FIX] Added warning for "–ring_size" with 0 as an argument (#2337) - Aditya Singh
  • Auto-read version in conf.py for docs from version.txt (#2356) - Smit Lunagariya
  • added repr in BaseEstimator from sklearn (#2307) - Ritu Raj Singh
  • added sgd param in sklearn_vw (#2348) - Ritu Raj Singh
  • added multiclassifier in vw_sklearn (#2332) - Ritu Raj Singh
  • Change RelWithDebInfo to use O3 instead of O2 and set it as default (#2344) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fixes AttributeError in multiclass_probabilities_label (#2346) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Unit tests dynamically link to libvw, so they can’t catch vw specific exceptions. See #2234. (#2235) - Rodrigo Kumpera
  • Uniform docstyle in sklearn_vw.py (#2305) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Implement Slates label parser (#2321) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix clang tidy issues in CCB (#2327) - Jack Gerrits
  • [FIX] Make Python Examples Up To Date With Scikit-Learn Version 0.22.1 (#2301) - Shivam Kumar Jha
  • Fix two typos in memory_tree.cc (#2331) - Ariel Faigon
  • Fix the issue #2322 to throw error for invalid epsilon argument passed. (#2325) - Mritunjay Kumar Sharma
  • Add convert_labels param in VW sklearn class (#2293) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix most valgrind errors in unit tests (#2318) - Jack Gerrits
  • Need to decrement failure count in case of expected failure (#2319) - Jack Gerrits
  • Create CI to run Valgrind (#2316) - Jack Gerrits
  • RunTests should not fail if Valgrind failed for a script or Python file (#2315) - Jack Gerrits
  • [FIX] Remove Outputs From Example Notebooks (#2304) - Shivam Kumar Jha
  • Fix str function in cbandit to produce correct format (#2297) - Smit Lunagariya
  • [STYLE] Make Python Files Adhere To Set Linting Standards (#2302) - Shivam Kumar Jha
  • Do not block stderr on Nan prediction + Non-logging logger (#2288) - Alexey Taymanov
  • Change CMakeLists.txt to have each file on its own line (#2294) - Jack Gerrits
  • Don’t initialize multiple variables in one line in search (#2289) - Jack Gerrits
  • Remove symbols without definitions (#2287) - Jack Gerrits
  • Move destruction of search_private to its destructor (#2286) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix race condition in daemon mode between parsing and inference threads. Fixes #2201 (#2283) - Rodrigo Kumpera
  • Invert hash now includes all weights even if they do not have an audit string (#2246) - Jack Gerrits
  • Use TCP_NODELAY for daemon sockets to avoid Nagle introducing long de… (#2269) - Rodrigo Kumpera
  • Fix warnings in unit_test by wrapping string constants in std::string temporary objects (#2280) - Jack Gerrits
  • Make Windows build better (#2279) - Jacob Alber
  • Remove profile from vw_clr.vcxproj (#2278) - Jack Gerrits
  • Allow overriding –epsilon value from model file (#2277) - Jacob Alber
  • Add chain hash option (#2214) - cheng-tan
  • Use _WIN32 (compiler definition) instead of WIN32 (sdk definition) (#2266) - Jack Gerrits
  • Support interpreting the string NaN as a float nan in dsjson (#2256) - Jack Gerrits
  • Support finding system version of RapidJSON (#2248) - Jack Gerrits
  • Update README.md (#2265) - Jack Gerrits
  • Run Linux build in both release and debug mode (#2261) - Jack Gerrits
  • Multiline parsing in python (#2259) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Fixes nameerror in Contextual_Bandit_Examples (#2263) - Smit Lunagariya
  • Unify python README with wiki (#2258) - peterychang
  • Fix segfault when reading from cache, using interactions and audit (#2250) - Jack Gerrits
  • Add deprecation warning for qcolon (#2252) - Jack Gerrits
  • Delete INSTALL (#2251) - Jack Gerrits
  • Silence cmake warning for policy CMP0076 (#2249) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix some cases where fuzzy compare would not work (#2243) - Jack Gerrits
  • Remove in_use field from example (#2237) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix most of the deprecation warnings for sklearn 0.22 (#2208) - peterychang
  • Add support for detecting available C++ standard on all platforms (#2233) - Jack Gerrits
  • Cb dro fix (#2239) - Paul Mineiro
  • Remove unimplemented function (#2238) - Jack Gerrits
  • winsdk update (#2224) - Alexey Taymanov
  • Distributionally robust cb (#2203) - Paul Mineiro
  • Parser string view (#2117) - peterychang
  • Performance fixes (#2220) - Jack Gerrits
  • Align prediction and label enum types (#2218) - Jack Gerrits
  • Update .travis.yml to fix Maven issue (#2225) - Jack Gerrits
  • Ataymano/random fixes (#2221) - Alexey Taymanov
  • Add macros for silencing deprecation warnings (#2219) - Jack Gerrits
  • Create pretty printer for gdb (#2209) - Jack Gerrits
  • Reduce probability of overflow (#2217) - Rajan
  • Fix version of NewtonSoft used by in vw_cli.vcxproj (#2215) - Jacob Alber
  • Fix simple typo: throogh -> through (#2213) - Tim Gates
  • Cleanup Headers (#2195) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix delete behavior for examples created using parse function (#2206) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix deprecated function usage, add file opened check (#2187) - Jack Gerrits
  • Learning2Search notebook format fix (#2204) - Alexey Taymanov
  • When building unit tests vw_c_wrapper DLL should be binplaced (#2189) - Jack Gerrits
  • Fix predict affecting model state when in library mode (#2190) - Jack Gerrits
  • Add vw_types.natvis to generated solution (#2186) - Jack Gerrits
  • Update test/README (#2198) - Ariel Faigon
  • Standardize copyright comments (#2185) - Jack Gerrits
entry.summary: This release includes major features such as continuous actions, square CB, probabilistic label tree, slates, CB distributionally robust optimization, CB ADF RND, Python wheels and many bug fixes.
